adr_address: 21 Rue de Chabrol, 75010 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Warm property offering casual rooms with flat-screens & free Wi-Fi, plus a furnished courtyard.

name: Hôtel Kabanel by HappyCulture

reviews.text: I had an amazing experience. The hotel was nice, a lot of amenities like free coffee and pastries, as a well as a nice indoor patio. Rooms were clean, comfortable and greatly maintained. No issues with outside noice either. Staff was great, specially in the night shift. We had great conversations and he even grabbed a map and marked all the best places to go to. Definitely recommend it.

We have just left this cute little hotel and I must say, it was just right for our needs. We stayed 3 nights after travelling into Paris on the Eurostar. The hotel is located a mere 10 minute walk from the eurostar station so was perfectly located. The staff were impeccable! Yassir in the daytime (handsome young guy with curls and spectacles) was so friendly, happy, helpful and just adorable. He is perfect for front of house! The night staff gentleman, Diddy, was also very lovely and friendly, as was the girl in the daytime with 2 pieces of hair loose at the front of her face, wonderful staff and fluent in english. We had a small problem with an overflow of water from the shower plug and this was sorted out in good time whilst we were out enjoying Paris. There was breakfast available from something like 7am until 10am if you wanted to add-on which was a simple process (i think it was €12.) There was also hot chocolate, hot drinks, sweets, mini pastries (croissants and pain au chocolat) available free of charge, as well as an ice box and a cold fresh water tap. All free in the reception area and a very nice touch!
The hotel is in the hub of a busy and lively location in Paris; restaurants, cafes and shops line the adjacent streets and there is plently to do and see. The metro stations were dotted around very close by, as well as a lovely little indoor market across the street from the hotel which sold fruits, meat, wines, bakery etc. The hotel itself was no frills but perfect for our needs and bigger than expected. We had 3 twin beds (2 pushed together) power outlets dotted around, an opening window with a view of the ground floor terrace (where guests could socialise etc) a small shower room that was a little cramped but definitely fit-for-purpose with shampoo, conditioner, towels and hairdryer. The room had a working tv, kettle, tea and coffee condiments. What more can I say?! Great little hotel with comfortable beds to rest and refresh yourself when exploring this fantastic city. I would recommend and visit this hotel again! Thank you Hotel Kabanel!

I had  a wonderful stay at this hotel together with my son and my mother. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, and the staff were always ready to help. I would especially like to thank Yasir at the reception – he was extremely kind and supportive. Thanks to him, our stay was very comfortable. Many thanks to the whole team!

Excellent Stay – Amazing Staff!
Had a great experience at the hotel! The room was clean and comfortable, and the service was top-notch. Special thanks to Yassir at the front desk—he was incredibly friendly, helpful, and professional. He made check out smooth and always greeted us with a smile. Would definitely come back!

We booked two rooms for  one night prior to our departure from Paris for the family, both rooms were adjacent and suitable for our needs. Close to many Cafes and Restaurants but located on a reasonably quiet street. Hotel staff provided great service, we dropped our luggage off early and returned to check in later only to find it had already been taken to our rooms up three level of stairs and they insisted on bringing it back down also. They were also very accomodating on late checkout as we had a late flight to catch. I would definitely stay there again
